projects.description: Display random quote from library of quotation objects
projects.review_comments: This was an excellent Project...Great work here!

projects.description: Page displays max 10 names and includes navigation system allowing users to filter through directory
projects.review_comments: Great job overall on this! Your code is reusable, concise and easier to maintain in the future

projects.description: Uses JavaScript to validate user input on a web form
projects.review_comments: Really great work here. Your name and email fields work beautifully...Nice regex here for sure.

projects.description: Browser-based version of the game 'Phrase Hunter' developed with OOP principles
projects.review_comments: Overall, your code is extremely legible, and concise, containing very fluid logic as you let your clean code do the talking! It was really refreshing to review your scripts, and I can't wait to see your future work!

projects.description: Make API request, asynchronously parse data, and dynamically display data.
projects.review_comments: Great work! I took a different approach (adding and remove the data vs. adding and removing the container) and I actually like this a bit better.

projects.description: This application is built on Reac leveraging poweful API's & tools like Create React App, Context, React Router, and Hooks. This application uses the built-in Fetch API to request photos from the Flickr API. Users are greeted with four rendered pages when the app loads. They can view picutes in the '/' route or they can use the navigation links to view those rendered components. Users can also search for photos either through the search input field or by entering a query into the url after the '/' character.
projects.review_comments: Well done! Your React Flickr Gallery project is impressive. You clearly know your way around React! Components look good and well reasoned. Nice work breaking the app into smaller reusable sections. Routes look good and function well. Nice work wiring up those routes.

projects.description: CRUD web application that manages a collection of library books. It utilizes JavaScript, Node.js, Express, Pug, SQLite and the ORM Sequelize.
projects.review_comments: App architecture is looking pro. And your UI is fantastic. All in all, exemplary work!

projects.description: I contributed to building, testing, and deploying an Alexa Skill for a non-profit missions agency, Live Global (please note - I do not have permission to share the code for the project at this time)
